This page is an overview of all '''ocean biomes'''.

== Biomes ==
List of all '''ocean biomes''':
* {{BiomeLink|Ocean}}
** {{BiomeLink|Deep Ocean|Deep}}
* {{BiomeLink|Frozen Ocean}}
** {{BiomeLink|Deep Frozen Ocean|Deep}}
* {{BiomeLink|Cold Ocean}}
** {{BiomeLink|Deep Cold Ocean|Deep}}
* {{BiomeLink|Lukewarm Ocean}}
** {{BiomeLink|Deep Lukewarm Ocean|Deep}}
* {{BiomeLink|Warm Ocean}}
[[Deep Warm Ocean|Deep warm oceans]] do exist in [[Bedrock Edition|bedrock edition]], but are unused, so they aren't included in this article.

== Description ==
[[File:Ocean colors.png|thumb|200px|The separate colors of each ocean variant {{in|java}}.]]
Oceans are vast expanses of [[water]] from sea level to the ocean floor, which is at a depth of roughly Y=45 for normal oceans and Y=30 for deep variants. The seafloor is fairly hilly, featuring multiple peaks and valleys.

All oceans together are the largest biomes by area, covering anywhere around 28â€“29% of the surface area of the [[Overworld]] when factoring in all of its variants. 

===Common generation===
All oceans are vast bodies of water that usually take up a lot of space. They all generate with ocean ruins, which are either there warm or cold variant. All oceans have a deep variant except for warm oceans. Ocean Monuments generate in these deep variants.

=== Ocean ===
{{Main|Ocean|Deep Ocean}}
Oceans generate with [[seagrass]] and [[kelp]] along the floor, which is made of sand or gravel. The floors of non-deep oceans can generate patches of dirt and clay.

=== Frozen Ocean ===
{{Main|Frozen Ocean|Deep Frozen Ocean}}
Frozen oceans do not generate with seagrass or kelp. The surface of frozen oceans are covered with ice, but not deep frozen oceans. Both frozens oceans and deep frozen oceans generate large icebergs.

===Cold Ocean===
{{Main|Cold Ocean|Deep Cold Ocean}}
Cold oceans have less seagrass compared to other ocean biomes, while deep cold oceans have more amounts of large seagrass. Cold ocean ruins generate in these biomes. Cold ocean floors mainly consist of gravel.

===Lukewarm Ocean===
{{Main|Lukewarm Ocean|Deep Lukewarm Ocean}}
Lukewarm oceans have more seagrass compared to other ocean biomes, and deep lukewarm oceans have more amounts of large seagrass. Warm ocean ruins generate in these biomes. Lukewarm ocean floors mainly consist of sand. [[Pufferfish]] can spawn in these biomes.

===Warm Ocean===
{{Main|Warm Ocean}}Warm ocean floors mainly consist of sand, similarly to lukewarm oceans. [[Coral Reef|Coral reefs]] and [[sea pickles]] are exclusive to this biome. [[Zombie nautili]] that spawn in this biome spawn as [[coral zombie nautiluses]]. Warm oceans do not have a deep variant, so [[ocean monuments]] can't spawn here.

{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java classic}}
|{{HistoryLine||0.0.12a|An infinite ocean now surrounds the map.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java infdev}}
|{{HistoryLine||20100227-1414|Added infinite worlds. Oceans generate as random parts of the terrain, similarly to mountains.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java beta}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=Pre-release|As part of a terrain generation overhaul, oceans have been made into their own proper [[biome]]. Previously, oceans were not considered their own biome. 
|The ocean level has been decreased by one block (64 to 63).
|Oceans have been made much larger and take up most of the map and their floors were made of a mix of clay, dirt and sand.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.7.2|dev=13w36a|Oceans have been made much smaller. In addition, oceans now only have gravel as the ocean floor. In contrast, old oceans had their floors made out of dirt, sand and clay.
|Ocean is now required for the new "Adventuring Time" [[achievement/Java Edition|achievement]].}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=14w25a|Added [[ocean monument]]s, which generate in oceans.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.13|dev=18w08a|Split the ocean into frozen, cold, lukewarm, and warm oceans, along with deep variants for each of them.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=18w08b|[[Deep Warm Ocean|Deeps warm oceans]] no longer generate.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=18w09a|Added [[underwater ruin]] structures, which generate in oceans.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=18w10a|Ocean is no longer required for the "Adventuring Time" [[advancement]].}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=18w11a|Added [[shipwrecks]], which generate in oceans.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.16|dev=20w06a|Underwater ruins and shipwrecks are now rarer.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.17|dev=21w06a|Ocean biomes generate with a stone floor below Y{{=}}50 instead of a gravel floor.<ref>{{bug|MC-214783||Oceans generate with stone floors|Fixed}}</ref>}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=21w15a|Oceans generate with a gravel floor once again.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.18|dev=21w43a|Removed deep warm oceans.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=21w44a|Ocean is once again required for the "Adventuring Time" [[advancement]].}}
